title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN ANTONIO — On a night where offensive struggles defined his teammates, David Robinson delivered a performance of singular, staggering dominance, carrying the San Antonio Spurs to a 95-83 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers.

The Spurs’ attack was a one-man symphony. Robinson, the Admiral, was an unstoppable force, pouring in a game-high 38 points on a night when no other Spur could crack the 15-point barrier. His offensive arsenal was on full display, a blend of powerful post moves and mid-range precision that the Lakers had no answer for. Beyond his scoring, Robinson anchored the defense with a monstrous 17 rebounds, controlling the glass and extinguishing any hope of a Laker second chance.

While Shaquille O’Neal fought valiantly for Los Angeles, posting a team-high 32 points, he was ultimately adrift without a supporting cast. Nick Van Exel’s 17 points provided a brief spark, but the rest of the Lakers’ offense sputtered into silence. The stark contrast was the story: Robinson’s 38-point, 17-rebound tour de force was met with a collective whimper from the rest of the purple and gold.

This was not merely a win; it was a statement. In a grinding, defensive battle, the Spurs had the ultimate luxury: a superstar who could transcend the struggle. Robinson didn’t just beat the Lakers; he shouldered the entire Spurs franchise and carried them across the finish line, a historic individual effort that secured a crucial team victory.
